input:
Sentence1: Ariel is our 5 month old baby. Sentence2: She had woke up the other morning extremely fussy. Sentence3: We couldn't figure out what was wrong at first. Sentence4: We then seen a fresh tooth popping through her gum line. 
 Sentence5: We had a week of hell as her tooth came in.

Sentence1: Timmy was competing in the 3 point competition at his school. Sentence2: The winner would have a chance to win a $1000 college scholarship. Sentence3: Timmy practiced shooting 3 pointers all weekend. Sentence4: He was ready when the day of the competition arrived. 
 Sentence5: Timmy went to the driving range the day of competition.

Sentence1: Ron had just found out that his family was moving to a farm. Sentence2: Ron was nervous. Sentence3: He knew nothing about animals. Sentence4: But when he got to the new home, he was surprised. 
 Sentence5: Ron hated being on the farm because he disliked the animals.

Sentence1: Rashid was an excellent car driver. Sentence2: One day Rashid's brother was late for work. Sentence3: Rashid offered to drive his brother. Sentence4: They got there with time to spare. 
 Sentence5: His brother yelled at him, and slammed the door.

Sentence1: Meghan was hired as a Scientist II for a company. Sentence2: She loved her job and was very good at it. Sentence3: After a year, Meghan wanted more responsibility at work. Sentence4: She talked to her boss and had an evaluation. 
 Sentence5: Meghan decided to quit her job.

Sentence1: Ana was a hardworking mom. Sentence2: One day she booked herself an afternoon at a spa. Sentence3: She had her whole body massaged. Sentence4: She even had hydrotherapy sessions. 
 Sentence5: Someday, she told herself, she would get a full-body massage.

Sentence1: Vianna was a full-time college student. Sentence2: She did not have a job and she needed money. Sentence3: She searched online for ways to make money from home. Sentence4: She found a site named amazon turk and started working from there. 
 Sentence5: Vianna now works everyday.

Sentence1: The suspect saw that the cell door was unlocked. Sentence2: He pushed on it and it opened. Sentence3: No one was watching him so he made an escape. Sentence4: He calmly walked out of the front of the police station. 
 Sentence5: The suspect decided to turn himself in.

Sentence1: Priya decided to try a new restaurant. Sentence2: She drove to a new cafe that opened. Sentence3: Priya sat at a booth. Sentence4: She ordered a mimosa and a breakfast burrito. 
 Sentence5: Priya decided not to eat and left.

Sentence1: Bill saved all his pocket change for 2 weeks last month. Sentence2: It was for a sucker from the store. Sentence3: He brought all his chance and bought the sucker. Sentence4: Walking home he tripped and fell. 
 Sentence5: Bill was sad to see the sucker covered with dirt on the ground.

Sentence1: Anna had been tending her garden all summer. Sentence2: She went outside to harvest. Sentence3: All her fruits and veggies were ready! Sentence4: She picked them one by one. 
 Sentence5: Anna doesn't like vegetables.

Sentence1: Emmy's dad took her to chose a kitten. Sentence2: There were two together in a cage. Sentence3: She couldn't split them up! Sentence4: It made her sad to have to chose. 
 Sentence5: Emmy left angry because she wanted a dog.

Sentence1: Harry had just moved to England. Sentence2: His new friends kept telling him to try fish and chips. Sentence3: Thus, Harry decided to go to the market to get fish and chips. Sentence4: Harry loved the fish and chips! 
 Sentence5: Harry thought the steak was delicious.

Sentence1: Gina's friend Mary wouldn't share. Sentence2: They both needed to use the school library books about dolphins. Sentence3: But Mary had beaten Gina and taken them all. Sentence4: And now she refused to share the books. 
 Sentence5: Mary was always trying to make Gina happy.

Sentence1: My brother loved candy. Sentence2: He ate a lot of it. Sentence3: He left the wrappers on the counter. Sentence4: Our mother scolded him for it. 
 Sentence5: She showered him with praise.

Sentence1: Gabe needed a desk in his room. Sentence2: But he didn't have a lot of money. Sentence3: He found plywood in his garage. Sentence4: So he made a desk out of it. 
 Sentence5: He polished the wood after he built the desk.

Sentence1: Jan was tired of winter and cold weather. Sentence2: She saw a commercial advertising a car that would be great for a trip. Sentence3: She bought the car and planned the trip on a map. Sentence4: She drove all over the state of Florida. 
 Sentence5: Winter is the season that sees the most skiers.

Sentence1: Gregory took a pottery class at a nearby night school. Sentence2: He was terrible at sculpture. Sentence3: He grew to like throwing pots on pottery wheels very much. Sentence4: Eventually he was making pots half as tall as he was. 
 Sentence5: He was very proud of his pots.

Sentence1: Francisco was excited to become an accountant one day. Sentence2: He knew that he would have to work hard to achieve that dream. Sentence3: He studied accounting at the local university. Sentence4: He passed all his exams! 
 Sentence5: Francisco became an accountant.

Sentence1: Kate wanted to start a new viral campaign. Sentence2: Kate wanted to find a way for everyday citizens to do something kind. Sentence3: Kate decided to create a video about her campaign. Sentence4: After posting her video, Kate got a overwhelming response. 
 Sentence5: Kate was disappointed.

Sentence1: Oliver was nervous about his wedding. Sentence2: He was worried that he would stutter during the vows. Sentence3: When the time came, he took a deep breath and began to speak. Sentence4: He stuttered, but his wife smiled and hugged him and he was okay. 
 Sentence5: Oliver was so grateful for his wife's love.

Sentence1: Annie was the top gymnast in her class. Sentence2: She received many awards and competed a lot. Sentence3: One day after a competition she remembered overdue homework. Sentence4: Her teacher would not let her turn in the homework. 
 Sentence5: She failed the class.

Sentence1: Barry was excited that he finally registered to vote. Sentence2: He went to the polling place near his home. Sentence3: While walking into the building he noticed all of the campaign signs. Sentence4: He already knew how he would cast his votes. 
 Sentence5: Barry voted.

Sentence1: John got a bike for his birthday. Sentence2: He didn't know how to ride. Sentence3: He practiced all week long. Sentence4: At the end of the week he took off his training wheels. 
 Sentence5: He was able to ride the bike just fine without them.

Sentence1: Bob decided to hike in the jungles of Indonesia. Sentence2: He bought a plane ticket and packed his bags. Sentence3: When he arrived, he realized he forgot his malaria vaccine. Sentence4: He decided to hike the jungle regardless. 
 Sentence5: Bob had also forgotten his shoes.

Sentence1: Dal needed money to go to college. Sentence2: He started doing the accounting for a local gang. Sentence3: When the feds raided the gang, he was going over their books. Sentence4: He was accidentally shot dead in the crossfire. 
 Sentence5: Dal made a bad decision.

Sentence1: Mike had a free Saturday. Sentence2: He drove to several car dealers. Sentence3: He was interested in seeing potential future cars for himself. Sentence4: Mike found a Jeep he fell in love with. 
 Sentence5: Mike never liked Jeeps.

Sentence1: Candy woke up excited because it was her birthday. Sentence2: But the whole day went by and no one gave her any gifts. Sentence3: She began to feel depressed and thought everyone had forgotten. Sentence4: Later, she got hungry and headed for the kitchen, but stopped. 
 Sentence5: She is very happy no one gave her gifts.

Sentence1: John's watch had been broken for some time. Sentence2: He hadn't gotten together the money to fix it. Sentence3: His wife decided to take it to get fixed and pay for it. Sentence4: She gave it to him when he came home for work. 
 Sentence5: John was very excited.

Sentence1: Iva and Brant were trying to conceive a child. Sentence2: They had been trying for six months with no success. Sentence3: At their doctor's appointment, they expressed discouragement. Sentence4: But then they saw the doctor smiling broadly. 
 Sentence5: The couple will be happy to know they have a baby on the way.

Sentence1: Anna wanted chicken wings. Sentence2: She drove her car all the way to Buffalo. Sentence3: There, she found an authentic wing restaurant. Sentence4: She ordered herself a dozen hot wings. 
 Sentence5: Anna ate all the wings as she drove home.

Sentence1: Bob needed money to buy food. Sentence2: He was sad that he couldn't eat because he had no money. Sentence3: He decided to write a book about his hard life. Sentence4: People immediately praised the book and bought thousands of copies! 
 Sentence5: The public reaction to the book means Bob still goes hungry.

Sentence1: Troy went over to play at Sam's house. Sentence2: The boys played with blocks and trucks and teddy bears. Sentence3: They also colored and played with finger paints. Sentence4: Sam's dad made them a snack of apples and caramel sauce. 
 Sentence5: Troy had lots of fun at Sam's house.

Sentence1: John and Meg had dated for five Year's. Sentence2: John loved Meg, and wanted to marry her. Sentence3: He decided to ask her to marry him tonight, after a movie date. Sentence4: When they walked out of the movies, he suddenly dropped to his knees. 
 Sentence5: He started screaming obscenities at Meg.

Sentence1: Bobby had never been to a carnival before. Sentence2: His friend Sam invited him to go with his family. Sentence3: There was so much to see and do! Sentence4: Bobby's favorite activity was riding on the ferris wheel. 
 Sentence5: Bobby enjoyed the carnival.

Sentence1: It was the second match of the volleyball season. Sentence2: Amy was hopeful she would get a chance to play. Sentence3: After the first game they were ahead. Sentence4: Her coach put her in the game. 
 Sentence5: She finally got her chance to play in the match.

Sentence1: Anna wanted to bake a cake for her mom's birthday. Sentence2: She tried twice, but both cakes fell flat. Sentence3: Then she found a solution. Sentence4: She went to the bakery and bought a cake. 
 Sentence5: She ate the cake alone at home.

Sentence1: Morgan loved tea. Sentence2: She bought a travel mug to bring tea with her to school. Sentence3: She drank all of her tea on the drive to school. Sentence4: So, when she got to school, she had to fill up with more hot water. 
 Sentence5: Morgan was glad she remembered to bring extra tea bags with her.

Sentence1: Barry loves bowling. Sentence2: However, he needed to find a place where he could bowl regularly. Sentence3: Barry looked through the yellow pages for a nearby bowling alley. Sentence4: Barry decided he would go bowling on Saturday at the new location. 
 Sentence5: Barry threw his bowling ball into the pool.

Sentence1: Carly was waiting for Sam to call her. Sentence2: He promised to on Friday. Sentence3: It was now late Saturday and she hadn't heard anything. Sentence4: Finally she decided to call him. 
 Sentence5: Carly ordered take-out over the phone.

Sentence1: Robbie and I went to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary. Sentence2: It was very elegant. Sentence3: We both had to dress formally in order to get a table. Sentence4: We enjoyed TEN courses over four hours. 
 Sentence5: Robbie and I wore shorts to the restaurant.

Sentence1: Michael loved to go hiking in the woods on weekends. Sentence2: He had never made it to the top of a mountain. Sentence3: One day he climbed very high,and finally reached the top. Sentence4: He could see land and water on the other side of the mountain. 
 Sentence5: Michael was disappointed in himself.

Sentence1: I noticed my hair was getting kind of long. Sentence2: I decided to try and get it cut that afternoon. Sentence3: Once I found a suitable barber, I dropped by for a cut. Sentence4: There wasn't a line, it was super quick! 
 Sentence5: I really liked my new hair cut.

Sentence1: Elle wanted a new car. Sentence2: She went to the dealership and selected the perfect one. Sentence3: The dealer helped set up a payment plan for her. Sentence4: Every month Elle paid five hundred dollars towards the car's price. 
 Sentence5: Elle was very responsible.

Sentence1: A new Organic Avenue store opened up in NYC and I checked it out. Sentence2: I was super excited to try it because I never went before. Sentence3: As I walked in, they had amazing salads and juices to try. Sentence4: I tried a summer salad and coconut water. 
 Sentence5: I decided never to go back to that restaurant.

Sentence1: Walter was lonely ever since his wife had passed away. Sentence2: He met a nice lady at bingo and became friendly with her. Sentence3: He felt guilty though about what his late wife might think. Sentence4: Walter had a vivid dream in which his late wife reassured him. 
 Sentence5: He decided to never date again.

Sentence1: Alan wanted to test his typing speed. Sentence2: He went on an online testing site to check. Sentence3: It was surprisingly fast. Sentence4: He tried to use it on his job applications. 
 Sentence5: It helped him get a job in an office.

Sentence1: Susie loves her grandma's banana bread. Sentence2: Susie called her grandma and asked her to send some. Sentence3: Grandma lived very far away. Sentence4: A week passed and grandma surprised Susie by coming to visit. 
 Sentence5: Susie was so happy.

Sentence1: Kelly was playing her new Mario game. Sentence2: She had been playing it for weeks. Sentence3: She was playing for so long without beating the level. Sentence4: Finally she beat the last level. 
 Sentence5: Kelly was so happy to finally beat it.

Sentence1: Joe and his friends had their soccer game today. Sentence2: Joe was nervous. Sentence3: He was nervous if he would win or not. Sentence4: Finally after the game, Joe's team won. 
 Sentence5: Joe was very proud of his team.

Sentence1: Gina had been at the park with her friend Pam for hours. Sentence2: Now the sun was setting. Sentence3: She said her goodbyes and headed home. Sentence4: When she arrived it was dark out. 
 Sentence5: Gina decided that it wasn't late enough and went back outside.

Sentence1: Chuck was tired from working. Sentence2: He closed his work for a while. Sentence3: He opened up the forum to chat with coworkers. Sentence4: After those nasty Zoltar hits he needed this break. 
 Sentence5: He then felt compelled to get back to work.

Sentence1: Ron and Kim wanted a new house. Sentence2: Ron decided to work overtime at work as much as he could. Sentence3: In a few Years he had saved all his overtime pay and had lots of cash. Sentence4: He and Kim started shopping for a new, bigger home. 
 Sentence5: They purchased a nice home in a new neighborhood.

Sentence1: Connie was invited to a party. Sentence2: When she arrived at the party, there was weird music playing. Sentence3: She looked around, and everyone was dancing weirdly. Sentence4: She was so freaked out, she turned around and left. 
 Sentence5: She decided to give it a chance, and returned to the party.

Sentence1: I had two dogs that were very close. Sentence2: The older dog got very sick and was put to sleep. Sentence3: The younger dog was very lonely. Sentence4: We have a neighbor dog come over to play. 
 Sentence5: Our dog really enjoys having the house to himself.

Sentence1: I had to take my son to the emergency room this summer. Sentence2: He was playing football with some friends and got hit in the head. Sentence3: He split his eyebrow open and we worried he had fractured his face. Sentence4: Thankfully, there was no fracture. 
 Sentence5: He has a scar from the stitches.

Sentence1: My mom always told me to brush my teeth. Sentence2: I didn't like to listen to my mom. Sentence3: I chose not to brush my teeth. Sentence4: i had to get them all pulled. 
 Sentence5: I have never been happier with my dental health.

Sentence1: Marc loved video games. Sentence2: His favorite video game series was releasing a new game. Sentence3: He worked very hard and saved up all his money. Sentence4: Finally, he was able to purchase the game. 
 Sentence5: Sadly, he was late for the football game.

Sentence1: I bought a television from an electronics store. Sentence2: It is a big flatscreen with a  high definition quality picture. Sentence3: The employee convinced me to buy a warranty for it just in case. Sentence4: A week later the television fell off my wall and broke. 
 Sentence5: The employee was later found dead.

Sentence1: Jill wanted to buy a new car. Sentence2: Jill drove her old car down to the car dealership. Sentence3: The salesman traded Jill's old car for a new car. Sentence4: After paying the salesman as well, Jill got her new car. 
 Sentence5: Jill was depressed.

Sentence1: Kay built himself a raft. Sentence2: He used planks of scrap wood, and nails. Sentence3: He worked hard on it all spring. Sentence4: Come summer, he tested it out in the lake. 
 Sentence5: Kay's raft floated.

Sentence1: Jesse had just started fifth grade. Sentence2: He tried to make friends with the other boys, but he couldn't. Sentence3: He decided to make friends with the girls instead. Sentence4: They girls welcomed him into their social groups happily. 
 Sentence5: Jesse was picked on by the other boys in school.

Sentence1: Sara eagerly awaited December 1st to come. Sentence2: When it finally did she went to her shed and pulled out tons of boxes. Sentence3: Slowly she started unpacking them and organizing their contents. Sentence4: She then began decorating the outside of the house. 
 Sentence5: Sara loved the Fourth of July.

Sentence1: Jay got stuck in an elevator on his way out of his office. Sentence2: It stopped between floors and the lights flickered. Sentence3: Jay was terrified! Sentence4: He battled his claustrophobia for two hours. 
 Sentence5: After two hours firefighters came and rescued Jay.

Sentence1: I've noticed a lot lately that people are scamming good requesters. Sentence2: Just today I watched them scam a requester I had grown to love. Sentence3: After thinking about what to do I decided to send an email. Sentence4: The requester was very responsive and decided to talk to me. 
 Sentence5: I like helping others.

Sentence1: Tracy never believed in marriage. Sentence2: Doug taught Tracy how to feel love again. Sentence3: Doug and Tracy made a commitment to each other. Sentence4: Doug broke his wedding vows to Tracy. 
 Sentence5: Tracy was happy with Doug.

Sentence1: A small snowstorm came through a town. Sentence2: The school roof buckled under the weight. Sentence3: A janitor climbed on top to inspect. Sentence4: The roof shook under the new weight. 
 Sentence5: The janitor was frightened.

Sentence1: Lilly made cranberry sauce for Thanksgiving. Sentence2: It was her first time meeting her boyfriend's parents. Sentence3: The meal was going well until she took a bite of what she had made. Sentence4: She realized she had forgotten to put sugar in it. 
 Sentence5: Her in-laws thought the cranberry sauce was much too sweet.

Sentence1: Jimmy went skateboarding this afternoon. Sentence2: It was the third time this week. Sentence3: He's getting good at it and really likes it. Sentence4: He fell once but hasn't given up. 
 Sentence5: Jimmy has decided to give away his skateboard.

Sentence1: Joe grew a big batch of peas in his garden. Sentence2: He brought the peas inside and shelled them all. Sentence3: Then he cooked them up in a big pot. Sentence4: He added ham, bacon, and carrots to make thick pea soup. 
 Sentence5: Joe thought about working in the garden as he ate the yummy soup.

Sentence1: Whit has a dog. Sentence2: It sleeps all the time. Sentence3: It doesn't just sleep like a normal dog. Sentence4: It snores like a human. 
 Sentence5: White doesn.

Sentence1: Rachelle worked hard to buy her first home. Sentence2: She was very proud of her accomplishment. Sentence3: Unfortunately, she lost her job and eventually, her home. Sentence4: She decided to stay in a hotel and find a new job. 
 Sentence5: She was happy at the turn of events.

Sentence1: Peter's friends invite him for a small Halloween party. Sentence2: He arrives late and hasn't had time to eat dinner. Sentence3: A friend offers him a slice of pumpkin pie at the party. Sentence4: The pie is delicious and it has whipped cream on the side. 
 Sentence5: Peter was happy his friend gave him food.

Sentence1: Janet always wanted to be in movies. Sentence2: She finally landed a role in a big film. Sentence3: It was going to debut nationwide last week. Sentence4: Unfortunately it was delayed. 
 Sentence5: Janet was disappointed.

Sentence1: Greta was turning ten Year's old. Sentence2: She wanted to throw a birthday party. Sentence3: Greta handed out invitations for the party at school. Sentence4: When the day of the party came, no one showed up. 
 Sentence5: Greta was very sad, but her parents cheered her up.

Sentence1: Amy wanted to straighten her curly hair. Sentence2: She went to the store and purchased a flat iron straightener. Sentence3: She washed and then spent 2 hours straightening her hair. Sentence4: It rained and her hair got wet. 
 Sentence5: Amy was devastated.

Sentence1: Liv jumped as she was startled by a loud pop. Sentence2: She realized it was the light bulb in her kitchen burning out. Sentence3: She got out a footstool and stepped on to it. Sentence4: It wobbled under her and she almost fell. 
 Sentence5: Liv decided to change a light bulb in the bathroom.

Sentence1: Rachel decided to donate blood at the local blood drive. Sentence2: She was a little nervous because this was her first time. Sentence3: The next day Rachel received a call from the doctor that she saw. Sentence4: The doctor told her that he had bad news. 
 Sentence5: Rachel broke down in tears.

Sentence1: Brandon was given a 10 page research paper to write for class. Sentence2: He begun working on the paper on his 2003 Dell laptop. Sentence3: Brandon stayed up until 1 in the morning to try and finish his paper. Sentence4: Suddenly, his computer crashed and died. 
 Sentence5: When he finished his paper he went to bed.

Sentence1: My niece applied for a job at the RMV two Year's ago. Sentence2: She got the job and was excited. Sentence3: They told her she needed a driver's license, which she did not have. Sentence4: She showed her employer a doctor's note showing she could not drive. 
 Sentence5: They decided it was ok to let her work as a secretary.

Sentence1: Ashley has felt sick all day today. Sentence2: She feels like she is going to throw up. Sentence3: She asks her boss if she can go home for the day. Sentence4: Her boss lets her leave work. 
 Sentence5: Ashley went home and went to bed to get better.

Sentence1: Kelly went down to the ocean to relax. Sentence2: She immediately went and put her feet in. Sentence3: As she put her feet in however, the wave captured her. Sentence4: Her clothes got soaked. 
 Sentence5: Kelly went home to change into dry clothes.

Sentence1: Last week a stunt double tried a new stunt. Sentence2: It involved a big car crash. Sentence3: Something went wrong and one of the safety harnesses snapped. Sentence4: The stunt man was ejected from his seat. 
 Sentence5: The stunt man loved it.

Sentence1: A man was running down a path in a state park. Sentence2: He came to a gate in the path. Sentence3: The gate looked low enough to jump. Sentence4: The man leapt as high as he could while running. 
 Sentence5: The man went under the gate.

Sentence1: I went to get burgers for my family last week. Sentence2: None of them could tell me what toppings they wanted. Sentence3: Everyone kept changing their mind. Sentence4: Eventually I just left and decided to get random ones. 
 Sentence5: My family was too demanding.

Sentence1: Arnold was scared of cats. Sentence2: He thinks all of them are creepy. Sentence3: One day he visited his girlfriend's house. Sentence4: His girlfriend has a cat. 
 Sentence5: Arnold dumped his girlfriend.

Sentence1: Today was Pinwheels for Peace Day. Sentence2: My teacher took the class towards the front of the school. Sentence3: Everyone planted pinwheels near the stop. Sentence4: When we looked at the wheels from afar, they were spinning. 
 Sentence5: Our teacher told us to go back and remove the pinwheels.

Sentence1: Harrison was playing a game of volleyball with friends. Sentence2: He hit the ball over the net and scored a point. Sentence3: However emily, on the opposing team also scored. Sentence4: The game was tied, until Harrison scored the winning point. 
 Sentence5: Harrison got angry with Emily.

Sentence1: Jenny wanted to learn how to ride a horse. Sentence2: She went to a local horse farm. Sentence3: After a quick lesson, she mounted the horse. Sentence4: A feeling of joy enveloped her as she rode the horse around a ring. 
 Sentence5: She decided to come back soon for another fun lesson.

Sentence1: Morgan loved tea. Sentence2: She bought a travel mug to bring tea with her to school. Sentence3: She drank all of her tea on the drive to school. Sentence4: So, when she got to school, she had to fill up with more hot water. 
 Sentence5: Morgan was glad the hot water tasted like coffee.

Sentence1: Paige was a very good student. Sentence2: She always got the best grades out of her friends. Sentence3: However one week she got very sick. Sentence4: She fell behind in her studies. 
 Sentence5: Paige had to rely on her friends for their support.

Sentence1: Ignacio wants to play a sport while he is in college. Sentence2: Since he was a good swimmer, he decides to try out for swim the team. Sentence3: Ignacio makes it onto the team easily. Sentence4: At the first swim meet, Ignacio wins second place! 
 Sentence5: Ignacio gave up swimming.

Sentence1: Eve needed a new couch in her parlor. Sentence2: But she could not afford to buy one! Sentence3: Then she went to a secondhand store and found a great one. Sentence4: She had it delivered and set up in her living room. 
 Sentence5: She bought a new couch to replace it.

Sentence1: I've been on an art kick lately. Sentence2: I received a drawing instruction book for Christmas. Sentence3: The book has a shopping list of necessary drawing supplies. Sentence4: I went to the store the other day and bought what I needed. 
 Sentence5: I went home and practiced drawing.

Sentence1: Brandon woke up this morning with his tooth missing. Sentence2: All excited he ran into his parents room. Sentence3: Brandon jumped up and down on their bed. Sentence4: He ran back to his room to put his tooth under his pillow. 
 Sentence5: Brandon checked the next day and found 50 cents under his pillow.

Sentence1: Dan was walking home from school and saw the window display. Sentence2: There was a train set in the window of the store. Sentence3: Dan wished so badly that he could own this train set. Sentence4: When Dan got home his mother told him she had a surprise. 
 Sentence5: She gave Dan the train.

Sentence1: Jaime wanted to ask jack to go to the school dance with her. Sentence2: After school she waited for jack outside of the front door. Sentence3: When jack was exiting he was walking hand in hand with another girl. Sentence4: Jaime froze unable to speak. 
 Sentence5: Jaime then told him that they were through.

Sentence1: Harry loved hockey. Sentence2: He decided to sign up to play for a local league. Sentence3: Harry attended the tryouts for the team. Sentence4: Harry hoped he did well enough to make the team. 
 Sentence5: A few days later, Harry heard that he made the team.

Sentence1: Gina and her friends had been given permission to go to the library. Sentence2: And had arrived to find the door locked. Sentence3: A teacher spotted the girls sitting in the hall. Sentence4: She wanted to see their hall pass. 
 Sentence5: The girls have her their passes.

Sentence1: We went hiking a few weeks ago. Sentence2: After deciding to leave, we decided on a forest not too far from us. Sentence3: Once we got there, the weather was perfect! Sentence4: After setting out down the trail, we saw a snake! 
 Sentence5: We were scared!

Sentence1: My children and I visited the local animal shelter. Sentence2: We looked at puppies and kittens in their cages. Sentence3: My daughters picked out a friendly puppy. Sentence4: They played with her and rubbed her belly. 
 Sentence5: I adopted the puppy for my daughter.

Sentence1: Megan has been struggling with a drug habit for years. Sentence2: She hit rock bottom when she lost her family and kids. Sentence3: Her distant family decided to stage an intervention. Sentence4: After the event, she got into a rehab facility. 
 Sentence5: She was able to get off drugs after some time.

Sentence1: Tom enjoyed puzzles growing up. Sentence2: He was not just outside of the escape room adventure. Sentence3: He calmed his breathing and readied himself mentally. Sentence4: Thirty minutes later, he exited the escape room in record time. 
 Sentence5: Tom was upset that he did poorly.

Sentence1: Amy wanted to get healthy. Sentence2: She purchased a smoothie blender. Sentence3: She made delicious fruit and vegetable smoothies. Sentence4: It took 20 minutes to clean the blender. 
 Sentence5: Amy was determined to lose weight.

Sentence1: My daughter had her baby shower in our Boston home. Sentence2: She invited friends and family in the area. Sentence3: Her old college roommate lives in Hawaii. Sentence4: She decided to surprise my daughter by flying 4800 miles. 
 Sentence5: My daughter was disappointed.

Sentence1: Amy walked home from volleyball practice alone. Sentence2: She called and told her friend Kim she was the worst player. Sentence3: Amy felt like a loser just saying it out loud. Sentence4: Kim reminded her it was the first day, and she would improve. 
 Sentence5: She loved being bad at volleyball.

Sentence1: Bobby folded his fruit roll-up into the shape of an airplane. Sentence2: He wound up his arm and threw roll-up airplane as hard as he could. Sentence3: It was far too heavy, though, and fell like a brick. Sentence4: Bobby decided that planes should be made out of paper. 
 Sentence5: Bobby was thirty-five years old.

Sentence1: My family's red car broke down last year. Sentence2: Our family needed a 2 door car that had good gas mileage. Sentence3: We visited a few people who were selling cars. Sentence4: My parents searched multiple dealerships. 
 Sentence5: My parents bought matching mopeds.

Sentence1: Jennifer was professional copywriter in a large city. Sentence2: She did good work but always received poor remarks on her reviews. Sentence3: Jennifer found out that her boss was trying to sabotage her! Sentence4: She decided to confront her boss about the negative remarks. 
 Sentence5: Jennifer stormed into his office and straightened her boss out.

Sentence1: Robert was a math genius. Sentence2: Robert put in extra time and effort in his studies. Sentence3: He was invited to a statistics contest for young children. Sentence4: He was determined to win at all cost. 
 Sentence5: Robert studied hard and came in first place at the contest.

Sentence1: The cop pulled me over at night. Sentence2: He said I had been speeding. Sentence3: He went back to his car. Sentence4: I waited with the lights flashing behind me. 
 Sentence5: I hoped he would just give me a warning.

Sentence1: After the state basketball championship reporters interviewed the team. Sentence2: Dan asked if this was live or recorded. Sentence3: The journalist informed him it was a live show. Sentence4: Dan said to the camera his father was his inspiration. 
 Sentence5: Dan was ashamed of this father.

Sentence1: Sandra had always wished for a pet turtle. Sentence2: She told her parents she would be responsible for it. Sentence3: At first her parents didn't agree. Sentence4: Eventually Sandra convinced her parents she should get a turtle. 
 Sentence5: She loved her new turtle.

Sentence1: Chuck always wanted to join the debate team at school. Sentence2: He has great ideas to debate with but he is scared of public speaking. Sentence3: He took a speech class over the summer to help. Sentence4: As soon as the school year started he signed up for the team. 
 Sentence5: Chuck dropped out of school.

Sentence1: Jason had always admired the fast movements of boxers he saw on TV. Sentence2: He started training to become a boxer in his spare time. Sentence3: He practiced jabs and jumped rope for hours each day. Sentence4: Finally he was a great boxer. 
 Sentence5: His wrestling matches were very exciting.

Sentence1: Joe bought a skateboard with his savings. Sentence2: He took his new skateboard to the park to show it off to his friends. Sentence3: While doing a trick, Joe fell and broke his arm. Sentence4: He spent four hours at the hospital getting his arm set. 
 Sentence5: After he left the hospital, Joe went surfing.

Sentence1: When I was a kid I really wanted to play checkers. Sentence2: I sat down with my grandpa and he taught me. Sentence3: At first, he was just teaching me but it became a special thing. Sentence4: As I got older, I continued to play checkers with him. 
 Sentence5: To this day I hate checkers.

Sentence1: Benson was bullied at school by another boy. Sentence2: Benson began losing sleep about it. Sentence3: He finally told his teachers at school about it. Sentence4: The teachers approached the bully about the problem. 
 Sentence5: They praised him.

Sentence1: Fred decided to play the lottery. Sentence2: He loved playing but never won. Sentence3: Yesterday he bought two tickets, Sentence4: When he went home he found out great news. 
 Sentence5: Fred had won the lottery.

Sentence1: Pat has a math test coming up. Sentence2: He studies very hard for a week. Sentence3: Pat makes flashcards to read on the bus. Sentence4: Pat aces his test. 
 Sentence5: Pat is sad.

Sentence1: Trish hated the outdoors. Sentence2: Her friends convinced her to go camping. Sentence3: She wasn't having a good time. Sentence4: They showed her how to fish and showed her the stars. 
 Sentence5: Eventually Trish grudgingly came to accept nature.

Sentence1: Todd and Ashley were dating. Sentence2: Todd got irritated with Ashley. Sentence3: He gave her the silent treatment. Sentence4: Ashley got upset. 
 Sentence5: She was mad because Todd wouldn't stop talking.

Sentence1: The high school student went to the dentist. Sentence2: She was told she needed braces again. Sentence3: She was not happy. Sentence4: She got braces and was in a lot of pain. 
 Sentence5: She couldn't wait to get her braces tightened each visit.

Sentence1: Carlos has always wanted to visit France. Sentence2: He decides that he should learn to speak French before he goes. Sentence3: He enrolls in a night class and studies very hard. Sentence4: Finally Carlos can speak French pretty well. 
 Sentence5: Carlos books a flight to Australia.

Sentence1: Stewart tried to finish his favorite task before going to bed. Sentence2: He got so engrossed in it, he forgot to keep the fire going. Sentence3: Shivering, he pulled a bunch of blankets around himself. Sentence4: He became very warm and content. 
 Sentence5: Stewart was glad that he remembered to keep the fire going.

Sentence1: The principal announced there would be a school dance that Friday. Sentence2: Mary became excited about the dance. Sentence3: She wanted Dan to ask her to the school dance. Sentence4: Dan saw Mary in the hallway and told her he needed to talk to her. 
 Sentence5: She was happy he asked her to the dance.

Sentence1: Greta was turning ten Year's old. Sentence2: She wanted to throw a birthday party. Sentence3: Greta handed out invitations for the party at school. Sentence4: When the day of the party came, no one showed up. 
 Sentence5: Greta was happy that nobody showed up.

Sentence1: Pam and Tom's baby was a light sleeper. Sentence2: Their thoughtless neighbor often left his dog outside barking all day. Sentence3: Every time Pam got her baby to sleep, the dog started barking. Sentence4: Pam fantasized about unleashing the dog so it would run away. 
 Sentence5: One night, Pam decided to release the dogs.

Sentence1: Wendy took her daughter to the orchard with her. Sentence2: They picked a huge bunch of apples and brought them home. Sentence3: Together, they peeled and cleaned the apples. Sentence4: Wendy and daughter baked them into a delicious pie. 
 Sentence5: Wendy does not like apples.

Sentence1: I decided I wanted to sign up for a christmas club with my bank. Sentence2: I called the teller and asked when i could do this. Sentence3: She told me I could come in at any time. Sentence4: I went in this morning and signed up for the plan. 
 Sentence5: I am glad I signed up.

Sentence1: Rick was trying to go to sleep. Sentence2: But there was a fly flying around his room. Sentence3: The noise of it was so irritating. Sentence4: But he was too exhausted to try to catch the fly. 
 Sentence5: While he was sleeping, the bee stung him.

Sentence1: I think yesterday was when I realized I shouldn't be a mathematician. Sentence2: I was at the grocery store, restocking for next week. Sentence3: I had bought around twenty items, and thought I was under my budget. Sentence4: When I went to check out, I was ten dollars over! 
 Sentence5: I then realized that I was not good at math.

Sentence1: Everyone told Matt he ate too much red meat. Sentence2: He ignored all their warnings about red meat and health problems. Sentence3: One day after a juicy burger, Matt had a heart attack. Sentence4: Matt became a vegetarian after he left the hospital. 
 Sentence5: He stayed heart attack free for the rest of his life.

Sentence1: Amelia decided to take a vacation to Mexico. Sentence2: She booked her flight and hotel. Sentence3: When she got to Mexico, she was sure to visit many different things. Sentence4: She loved every moment of it. 
 Sentence5: Amelia decided to never go back to Mexico.

Sentence1: Mark notices that his teeth are beginning to hurt one day. Sentence2: He decides to visit his dentist to see what is the matter. Sentence3: The dentist tells Mark that he needs to have his wisdom teeth removed. Sentence4: Mark agrees to have the surgery done. 
 Sentence5: Mark hoped the procedure would stop his dental pain.

Sentence1: Margie had a Christmas cactus. Sentence2: It never bloomed. Sentence3: She gave the plant to Desi. Sentence4: Desi took good care of the plant. 
 Sentence5: The goldfish were very happy and healthy.

Sentence1: Joe was walking home one night. Sentence2: Out of nowhere, a man approached and stabbed him. Sentence3: Joe was badly injured! Sentence4: He staggered to the nearest hospital. 
 Sentence5: It took him 2 weeks in the hospital to recuperate.

Sentence1: Franz decides he would like to be closer to his family. Sentence2: He books a trip to visit his cousin in Philadelphia. Sentence3: Franz and his cousin visit museums and drink coffee together. Sentence4: They have a terrific visit together. 
 Sentence5: Franz vows to never visit his cousin again.

Sentence1: Lisa wanted to make a cake. Sentence2: First she had to decide what kind of cake she wanted to bake. Sentence3: After she had to go buy the ingredients. Sentence4: She decided to make a chocolate cake. 
 Sentence5: Lisa hated baking.

Sentence1: Ella had packed a picnic for her family. Sentence2: But she had forgotten to bring forks! Sentence3: They had no way to eat their chicken and watermelon. Sentence4: Then they all started to laugh and eat with their hands. 
 Sentence5: Ella was happy that the picnic wasn't ruined.

Sentence1: Amy woke up extra hungry today. Sentence2: Unfortunately, she also woke up very late. Sentence3: She rushed around the house and had no time for breakfast. Sentence4: When she made it to work, she realized her coworker brought breakfast! 
 Sentence5: She did not want to eat.

Sentence1: I always try to go to bed on time. Sentence2: Last night I was hooked watching a new tv show. Sentence3: Before I knew it it was really late. Sentence4: I should have been asleep hours ago. 
 Sentence5: The television show had hooked me in.

Sentence1: Dana's mother came to visit for a week. Sentence2: Dana's husband Glenn thinks her mother is trying to poison him. Sentence3: During breakfast Glenn stomach starts to cramp. Sentence4: Glen becomes outraged. 
 Sentence5: However, turns out to just be gas.

Sentence1: Ken met a nice man online, and they decided to go on a date. Sentence2: They met at a nice restaurant and shook hands. Sentence3: Ken and his date ordered food and had small talk. Sentence4: While they ate, Ken decided that he really liked the man. 
 Sentence5: Ken asked him for a second date.

Sentence1: Nya had been asked on a paintball trip with friends. Sentence2: She was nervous about going. Sentence3: But she went anyways, hoping to have fun. Sentence4: She shot paintballs at her friends and laughed the whole time. 
 Sentence5: She loved it so much she planned a trip for the next week.

Sentence1: Ford was proud of his high GPA. Sentence2: He worked every evening on assignments in order to improve it. Sentence3: Ford's friends warned him that he was missing out on fun. Sentence4: Later in life, Ford became a successful lawyer. 
 Sentence5: Ford was sad that he achieved so much.

Sentence1: Benson was bullied at school by another boy. Sentence2: Benson began losing sleep about it. Sentence3: He finally told his teachers at school about it. Sentence4: The teachers approached the bully about the problem. 
 Sentence5: The bully was expelled.

Sentence1: Ethan loved to make Youtube videos. Sentence2: However, he was too embarrassed to upload any videos. Sentence3: One day he gained the courage to upload one. Sentence4: Soon he had one hundred views! 
 Sentence5: Ethan decided to never make Youtube videos again.

Sentence1: I walked inside of the dentists office. Sentence2: After signing the attendance board, the dentist greeted me. Sentence3: He showed me where to sit. Sentence4: Afterwards, he started to operate on my teeth. 
 Sentence5: I left the dentist's office with a signed petition.

Sentence1: A little boy was in the third grade. Sentence2: He was very smart but struggled with reading. Sentence3: Whenever he read out loud his classmates laughed at him. Sentence4: He started to practice reading every single day. 
 Sentence5: At the end of the year, he did well on his reading test.

Sentence1: Fred receives a specialty coffee maker for Christmas. Sentence2: He finally opens it after leaving it in its box for a few weeks. Sentence3: Fred decides to make himself a cappuccino. Sentence4: To his surprise, it tastes just as good as the ones he buys outside. 
 Sentence5: Frank switched to tea and donated the coffee maker.

Sentence1: My son participated in a cub scout toy car derby. Sentence2: Father and son teams designed small matchbox cars. Sentence3: Some teams designed fancy cars. Sentence4: We designed a simple car, which actually won the derby. 
 Sentence5: My son and I did not do well.

Sentence1: Alice wanted to go to school to become a veterinarian. Sentence2: She worked hard all throughout high school to have good grades. Sentence3: She even volunteered at the local zoo to pad her resume. Sentence4: When the time came, she applied to many different schools. 
 Sentence5: She cried of joy when she received her first acceptance letter.

Sentence1: Paul graduated from high school. Sentence2: He did not get accepted into college. Sentence3: His mom advised him to get a job. Sentence4: Paul agreed. 
 Sentence5: Paul got a job.

Sentence1: One thing that Tina wanted to do in NYC was go to a hot dog stand. Sentence2: She finally saw a Nathan's stand and ordered a traditional one. Sentence3: The food tasted amazing. Sentence4: It was expensive but worth it. 
 Sentence5: She was sad about the hot dog.

Sentence1: Greg like to throw anything he could get his hands on. Sentence2: One day he threw a stone as far as he could. Sentence3: It went through the window of his neighbors house. Sentence4: He was scared but wanted to do the right thing. 
 Sentence5: Greg blamed the broken window on another boy.

Sentence1: Margie had a Christmas cactus. Sentence2: It never bloomed. Sentence3: She gave the plant to Desi. Sentence4: Desi took good care of the plant. 
 Sentence5: The cactus flourished under his care.

Sentence1: Yesterday, Anna decided to take a nap. Sentence2: She got comfortable in her chair and closed her eyes. Sentence3: Just as she fell asleep, her daughter's puppy jumped into her lap! Sentence4: She was very surprised. 
 Sentence5: She cuddled with the adorable puppy, happy to see it.

Sentence1: Jerry wanted to start a new career. Sentence2: He searched the classified ads for job postings. Sentence3: He found a desirable posting in one of the ads. Sentence4: He emailed his resume to the recruiter. 
 Sentence5: Jerry decided later it was easier to collect unemployment.

Sentence1: Mark and Frank were swimming in Mark's family's pool. Sentence2: Mark's mother brought out a sponge ball to them. Sentence3: Mark and Frank had fun tossing the ball back and forth. Sentence4: But then the saturated ball accidentally hit Mark's mother! 
 Sentence5: Mark and Frank apologized profusely.

Sentence1: Johnny's teacher treated the class to homemade snow cones. Sentence2: The teacher let each student pick a colored syrup topping. Sentence3: When his turn came, Johnny got mad when he saw only one color left. Sentence4: Johnny's teacher asked what was wrong. 
 Sentence5: Johnny told the teacher he was upset he didn't get more colors.

Sentence1: Sean and Sara were going to buy a guitar. Sentence2: Sean picked Sara up and they drove to the store. Sentence3: Inside, they played with several different guitars. Sentence4: Sara picked her favorite and they brought it to the counter. 
 Sentence5: Sara decided to buy a Viola instead.

Sentence1: Brendon used to work with mike. Sentence2: One day Mike moved his chair while he was standing. Sentence3: He went to sit down and fell. Sentence4: Mike couldn't help but laugh at the site. 
 Sentence5: Brendon got angry because he was in serious pain.

Sentence1: Jill went on a road trip last month. Sentence2: She wanted to travel from Boston to Seattle. Sentence3: Halfway through, her car broke down. Sentence4: She spent hours on the side of the road, waiting for AAA. 
 Sentence5: Jill was glad that they arrived so quickly.

Sentence1: Last night we wanted to order a pizza. Sentence2: Half of us wanted pepperoni. Sentence3: The other half wanted sausage. Sentence4: I made a decision. 
 Sentence5: We ordered a pizza with separate toppings on each half.

Sentence1: Chad wanted to bowl a perfect game. Sentence2: Last Saturday he came close. Sentence3: He had all strikes and only needed two more. Sentence4: He missed his second to last one. 
 Sentence5: Chad scored a touchdown after asking his coach for advice.

Sentence1: Danny bought a boat. Sentence2: His nearby marina was having a race. Sentence3: He decided to enter. Sentence4: Danny and his best friend manned the boat. 
 Sentence5: They prepared for the start of the race.

Sentence1: The old dog was doing worse than usual. Sentence2: He stopped eating and cried when he moved. Sentence3: Cheryl avoided making the appointment with the vet. Sentence4: She told her husband that she would make the appointment tomorrow. 
 Sentence5: Cheryl loved the dog and prayed he would get better.

Sentence1: The two hunters debated their location within the forest. Sentence2: They did not know if they had reached the right spot. Sentence3: Their attention was distracted when a huge buck entered the glade. Sentence4: The men were struck with awe. 
 Sentence5: It was then that they knew they were in the right spot.

Sentence1: Marisse went to the auction to look for some items. Sentence2: At the registration desk, they asked her for her credit card. Sentence3: She took out some cash instead and used that as a deposit. Sentence4: She went on to bid on some storage lockers and won two. 
 Sentence5: Sadly, they were both filled with junk.

Sentence1: Amy arrived home from volleyball practice and sat on the couch. Sentence2: Her mother walked in and gasped. Sentence3: She told Amy she needed to shower since she was sweaty. Sentence4: They argued since Amy thought it was no big deal. 
 Sentence5: Amy gave in and took a shower.

Sentence1: It snowed so hard that school was called off for the day. Sentence2: The boys put on their coats, hats, gloves and boots and went outside. Sentence3: They built a tall snowman and a snow fort. Sentence4: They had a snowball fight. 
 Sentence5: They took their clothes off to sunbathe.

Sentence1: Kaylee always wanted a puppy. Sentence2: On her birthday her parents took her to a farm. Sentence3: There were lots of beagle puppies there. Sentence4: Her parents told her she could pick a puppy for her birthday. 
 Sentence5: Kaylee was really disappointed.

Sentence1: I went to a bar with some friends of mine. Sentence2: I was broke, but thought I could keep them company. Sentence3: It turns out that they were all broke as well. Sentence4: None of us bought anything, and we talked for hours. 
 Sentence5: After that we all decided to go to a restaurant.

Sentence1: Amy was driving to school when her car stopped. Sentence2: She called her dad. Sentence3: He came and informed her the fuel pump was out. Sentence4: They called a tow truck to tow the car home. 
 Sentence5: Amy then had to walk to school.

Sentence1: Last week I had to give a big speech. Sentence2: I never prepared and only new the very basics. Sentence3: I figured i would just go in and fake it. Sentence4: I used big words and tried to sound smart. 
 Sentence5: I stopped talking and went home.

Sentence1: Alex awoke to bright sunlight. Sentence2: She looked at her clock alarm. Sentence3: She realized she must have overslept! Sentence4: Alex jumped out of bed. 
 Sentence5: She went back to sleep.

Sentence1: I put the black plastic rose in a vase with water. Sentence2: I left it atop my bookcase for a few weeks. Sentence3: Ten people asked me about it. Sentence4: They wanted to know why I had a watered, fake flower. 
 Sentence5: After a few weeks the flower died.

Sentence1: Ben decided to treat himself to a coffee. Sentence2: He paid for the coffee using his debit card. Sentence3: Later, the bank called him saying he over-drafted. Sentence4: They explained that he had to pay a thirty dollar charge. 
 Sentence5: Ben was happy after getting the call from the bank.

Sentence1: Danny was working at the local ice cream shop this summer. Sentence2: He was very excited to have started his first job. Sentence3: On his first day a little boy dropped his ice cream on the floor. Sentence4: Without hesitation, Danny knew just what to do. 
 Sentence5: He refused to give him another scoop.

Sentence1: Kelly went to a Celtics game yesterday. Sentence2: She loved going to games. Sentence3: The clock was ticking and time was running out. Sentence4: Thankfully the Celtics won. 
 Sentence5: Kelly jumped for joy.

Sentence1: Jason was terrified of spiders. Sentence2: He went to a therapist and discussed his fear. Sentence3: His therapist said he should confront his fear to overcome it. Sentence4: Jason's homework was to look for a spider in his basement. 
 Sentence5: Jason took a hot shower.

Sentence1: Hailey was participating in her school marathon. Sentence2: However she forgot to bring her running shoes. Sentence3: Hailey was still determined. Sentence4: She asked her teacher if she could borrow her's for the day. 
 Sentence5: Hailey was weak willed.

Sentence1: Lenny wanted to watch a movie. Sentence2: He drove to the local Hollywood video. Sentence3: Lenny rented three horror movies. Sentence4: Lenny went next door and bought a pizza from a shop. 
 Sentence5: When he got home, he prepared to return his three movies.

Sentence1: Jeremy's mother didn't approve of his lifestyle. Sentence2: When he was 21, Jeremy decided to move out. Sentence3: He found an apartment in a nearby state with a new job. Sentence4: After several Years he cleaned up, and finances his own life. 
 Sentence5: Jeremy had to move back in with his mother.

Sentence1: Sally was on her work break. Sentence2: She went to get tacos from the taco stand outside. Sentence3: She realized she had forgotten her wallet at home. Sentence4: A nice man noticed what happened and offered to pay. 
 Sentence5: Sally was grateful for his kindness.

Sentence1: Gina's friend Tami had a folder she didn't want anyone else to have. Sentence2: Gina wanted one but didn't know where to buy one. Sentence3: Now Tami had a new Lisa Frank Trapper Keeper. Sentence4: Gina was jealous since she wanted one too. 
 Sentence5: Gina mowed the whole yard and had no help from anyone.

Sentence1: My laboratory professor was explaining today's lab. Sentence2: He told us not to pour water followed by an acid. Sentence3: While I was looking at my notes, I barely paid attention. Sentence4: When the experiment began, I poured water before an acid in a tube. 
 Sentence5: My professor was very upset.

Sentence1: Michael saw a squirrel living in the dumpster one day. Sentence2: He thought it was a cute way for the squirrel to say warm. Sentence3: When the trash was taken to the landfill, the squirrel was gone! Sentence4: A few weeks later, Michael saw another squirrel in the dumpster. 
 Sentence5: Michael hoped the new squirrel would fare better than the first.

Sentence1: Ana had been putting off doing laundry. Sentence2: Finally she could avoid it no longer. Sentence3: She carried all her clothes to the laundromat. Sentence4: Over several hours, she washed and dried them. 
 Sentence5: Ana decided never to wait that long again.

Sentence1: Ben woke up late. Sentence2: Ben decided to skip breakfast and went to work. Sentence3: Work was too busy to take a break or eat lunch. Sentence4: After work, Ben was caught in real bad traffic. 
 Sentence5: Ben was able to get home quickly.

Sentence1: Barry had only one thousand dollars left in his bank account. Sentence2: He needed to find a job. Sentence3: He searched for 3 months. Sentence4: Eventually, his money ran out. 
 Sentence5: He had to go to a homeless shelter.

Sentence1: One day Matilda was extremely bored. Sentence2: So she picked a name and address out of the phone book. Sentence3: She wrote a silly letter to that random person. Sentence4: And the recipient wrote back to Matilda! 
 Sentence5: Matilda then got a letter from her brother.

Sentence1: Al and Val were very close twins. Sentence2: They dressed alike, talked alike and were together 24/7. Sentence3: One day, Val was diagnosed with terminal cancer. Sentence4: She soon died, and Al was completely devastated. 
 Sentence5: Al felt even lonelier as time went on.

Sentence1: Ricky fell while hiking in the woods. Sentence2: He was terrified! Sentence3: He thought he had fallen into a patch of poison ivy. Sentence4: Then he used his nature guide to identify the plant. 
 Sentence5: He was relieved to find out he was wrong.

Sentence1: Sandy had taken dance for ten Year's. Sentence2: She was about to graduate and wanted to tryout for dance team. Sentence3: She practiced and practiced. Sentence4: On the day of tryouts, she broke her toe. 
 Sentence5: She could not participate in the tryout with the injury.

Sentence1: Teresa was an artist. Sentence2: She made a beautiful sculpture of an angel. Sentence3: She entered it into an art contest. Sentence4: The judges liked the sculpture very much. 
 Sentence5: She won the contest and was proud of herself.

Sentence1: Gina was given lunch detention. Sentence2: She was expecting worse. Sentence3: She fought the smile that tried to creep across her face. Sentence4: She didn't want the principal to know she was relieved. 
 Sentence5: Gina always chose bananas over oatmeal.

Sentence1: Kim wakes up and decides to drive to the mall. Sentence2: She gets there and promptly spends 250$ on a pair of shoes. Sentence3: Later, she finds a purse to match the shoes. Sentence4: After buying an outfit to match, she decides to head home. 
 Sentence5: Kim put her things down and decided to go to a movie instead.

Sentence1: Farmer Bill called out the the cows in the field. Sentence2: The came running in for their food. Sentence3: Bill poured out some grains for the cows in big bins. Sentence4: The cows happily ate their dinner. 
 Sentence5: Bill searched for the cows.
